result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Ray Rodriguez

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed. DPA Supervision Report 11.3.22

Defendant Richard Ray Rodriguez in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Richard Ray Rodriguez.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared in court on behalf of Patrick T. Franken for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status Conference. Parties provide an update to the court. Case is no longer on a global resolution track. Court thereby orders case remain calendared as previously set for a sentencing hearing on 01/09/2022 at 03:00 pm, before Br 17.

Court orders that defendant must attend ALL future court court dates in all cases. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit. Defendant must comply with the terms of bail on the defendants 22CF3001. Defendants curfew will remain in effect as previously ordered, with the modification that the defendant can not leave the house for DPA appointments. Court orders defendant can not be present in a vehicle where a firearm is present.

Defendant Richard Ray Rodriguez in court.  Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court for Richard Ray Rodriguez.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defense requested previously to have defendant enter into DTC, the State objected. Defense requested a global resolution with defendant's other pending felony case, 2022CF003001, set before Judge Grayson, Branch 16. State moves to revoke. Defense and Defendant CONCEDED that there is a FACTUAL basis for the REVOCATION. The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of judgment of conviction. Court GRANTS global resolution with Branch 16.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Richard Ray Rodriguez in court.  Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court for Richard Ray Rodriguez.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
State renews their motion to revoke the DPA. Court takes the State's motion under advisement. Defense reports interest in DTC for the defendant. Defendant has a new case set before Branch 16. Case needs to be staffed. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Comply with all conditions of the DPA. Comply with all conditions of bail in the defendant's other pending felony case, 2022CF3001. Defendant can not be in an automobile where a firearm is present. Court imposed a 24/7 curfew with release for defendant to go directly to and from medical appointments/treatments, appointments for defendant to comply with the DPA, legal office appointments and employment.

Defendant Richard Ray Rodriguez in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has a new felony case. The State moves to revoke the DPA. The court takes the State's motion for revocation under advisement. Court addressed bail. The court heard arugments from both parties as to bail. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Received and Filed. DPA Discharge Report 8.1.22
Received and Filed, DPA Supervision Amended Report 8.1.22
Received and Filed, DPA Supervision Report 8.1.22

Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; DPA Violation Report 7.25.22
Court will address at the next court date.

Defendant Richard Ray Rodriguez in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case in court for violation. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Defendant is working on treatment. Case remains calendared for Review Hearing.

Received and Filed, DPA Violation Report 7.5.22
Court addressing on 7/6/2022

Defendant Richard Ray Rodriguez in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Report reviewed. Defendant is not compliant. Defendant needs to attend testing. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Case adjourned for Review Hearing. 
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.  Review hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
Received and Filed, DPA Supervision Report 7.5.22
Received and Filed, DPA Supervision Report 7.5.22

Defendant Richard Ray Rodriguez (via Zoom) in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin (in person).  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defendant attended 4 out of 5 office contacts. Defendant needs to complete community service. Defendant needs to complete CARS assessment. Defendant needs to test negative in order to receive the benefit of this agreement. Court held colloquy with the defendant. Case was staffed. Case adjourned for Review Hearing in branch 21.  Review hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Received and Filed, DPA Supervision Report 6.6.22

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit.
 Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 21.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. 
Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of her client.

Defendant Richard Ray Rodriguez in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Richard Ray Rodriguez appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom. 
Court WITHDRAWS previously stayed bench warrant. 
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Dawn Marie Rablin in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Case heard via Zoom. 
  Defendant does not appear.  Defense request Court impose and stay a warrant.  State has no objection. Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until next court date. Case adjourned for Calendar Call and Initial Appearance in branch 21.
  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Calendar call scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 09:40 am.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 09:40 am.
Received and Filed, Waiver of Right to Personal Appearance
Received and Filed, Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver
Received and Filed, Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights / Addendum
Received and Filed, Jury Instructions
Received and Filed, Deferred Prosecution Agreement
received and filed.
